meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means "exit" so what is the verb form of this? It is <vocabulary>to exit</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You want to exit the room you're in. Why? Because it has a <reading>de</reading>ad (で) body in it. Seriously. You should exit now. It's a <reading>de</reading>ad (で) <reading>roo</reading>m (る)!
